original_title: Sri Lanka rupee opens flat at Rs328.00/20, bond yields down
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee opened stable at 328.00/20 to the US dollar Tuesday, dealers said.
The Colombo Stock Exchange opened up. The All Share Index was up 0.13 percent, or 13.87 points, at 10,560.
The S&P SL20 index of liquid stocks was up 0.52 percent, or 15.59 points at 2,993. Turnover was at 31 million.
A bond maturing on 01.08.2026 was quoted at 14.50/60 percent from 14.60/75 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2028 was quoted at 14.65/75 percent from 14.70/85 percent. (Colombo/Nov21/2023)
